content.question: Which of the following evidence was used by the American Temperance Society in the excerpt to explain why people would join the temperance movement?

choices.label: The abstention from alcohol would extend American life expectancy.
The development of treatments for alcoholism would change the habits of men.
The formation of a national movement would eliminate the consumption of alcohol.
The use of specific studies would convince people to believe the movement’s goals.

content.answer: The use of specific studies would convince people to believe the movement’s goals.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify the evidence used in a source to support an argument.
